name: Chocolate Martini
description: The chocolate martini is a popular, rich, and creamy dessert cocktail that typically combines vodka, chocolate liqueur, and crème de cacao. Believed to have been invented by movie stars Rock Hudson and Elizabeth Taylor in the 1950s, it has since become a staple on dessert menus worldwide.

ingredients.ingredient: ounce half-and-half or heavy cream (optional, for a creamier texture)
syrup and/or chocolate shavings for garnish (optional)

directions: Prepare the glass: If desired, hold a chilled martini glass at an angle and drizzle chocolate syrup in a spiral around the inside. For a chocolate-rimmed glass, place some chocolate syrup or a small amount of water on a plate, dip the rim to wet it, then dip the rim into a separate plate of chocolate shavings or a mix of cocoa powder and sugar. Place the prepared glass in the freezer for a few minutes to set the chocolate.
Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Add the vodka, chocolate liqueur, crème de cacao, and half-and-half (if using).
Shake vigorously: Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds, until the outside of the shaker is frosty and well-chilled.
Serve: Strain the mixture into your prepared martini glass.
Garnish: Garnish with extra chocolate shavings or a sprinkle of cocoa powder on top, if desired.
Simpler Version: For a less rich, two-ingredient martini, combine 2 ounces of vodka and 1 ounce of chocolate liqueur.
With Irish Cream: Substitute the half-and-half and/or some of the crème de cacao with Irish cream liqueur (like Baileys) for a slightly different flavor profile.
White Chocolate Martini: Use white chocolate liqueur and, optionally, peppermint schnapps or heavy cream for a white chocolate twist.
